content.name: genefilter
content.description: Some basic functions for filtering genes.
content.author:
Robert Gentleman [aut],
 Vincent J. Carey [aut],
 Wolfgang Huber [aut],
 Florian Hahne [aut],
 Emmanuel Taiwo [ctb] ('howtogenefinder' vignette translation from
 Sweave to RMarkdown / HTML.),
 Khadijah Amusat [ctb] (Converted genefilter vignette from Sweave to
 RMarkdown / HTML.),
 Bioconductor Package Maintainer [cre]
content.title: genefilter: methods for filtering genes from high-throughput\n experiments
content.imports: MatrixGenerics (>= 1.11.1), AnnotationDbi, annotate, Biobase,\n graphics, methods, stats, survival, grDevices
content.suggests: class, hgu95av2.db, tkWidgets, ALL, ROC, RColorBrewer,\n BiocStyle, knitr

content.name: ggplot2
content.description:
A system for 'declaratively' creating graphics,
 based on "The Grammar of Graphics". You provide the data, tell 'ggplot2'
 how to map variables to aesthetics, what graphical primitives to use,
 and it takes care of the details.
content.author:
Hadley Wickham [aut] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4757-117X>),
 Winston Chang [aut] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1576-2126>),
 Lionel Henry [aut],
 Thomas Lin Pedersen [aut, cre]
 (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5147-4711>),
 Kohske Takahashi [aut],
 Claus Wilke [aut] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7470-9261>),
 Kara Woo [aut] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5125-4188>),
 Hiroaki Yutani [aut] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-3385-7233>),
 Dewey Dunnington [aut] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9415-4582>),
 RStudio [cph, fnd]
content.title: Create Elegant Data Visualisations Using the Grammar of Graphics
content.imports: digest, glue, grDevices, grid, gtable (>= 0.1.1), isoband,\n MASS, mgcv, rlang (>= 0.3.0), scales (>= 0.5.0), stats, tibble,\n withr (>= 2.0.0)
content.suggests:
covr, dplyr, ggplot2movies, hexbin, Hmisc, knitr, lattice,
 mapproj, maps, maptools, multcomp, munsell, nlme, profvis,
 quantreg, RColorBrewer, rgeos, rmarkdown, rpart, sf (>= 0.7-3),
 svglite (>= 1.2.0.9001), testthat (>= 2.1.0), vdiffr (>= 0.3.0)

content.name: plotly
content.description: Create interactive web graphics from 'ggplot2' graphs and/or a custom interface to the (MIT-licensed) JavaScript library 'plotly.js' inspired by the grammar of graphics.

Carson Sievert [aut, cre] (ORCID:
 <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4958-2844>),

 <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1994-3581>),
 Pedro Despouy [aut],

 Plotly Technologies Inc. [cph]
content.title: Create Interactive Web Graphics via 'plotly.js'
content.imports:
tools, scales, httr (>= 1.3.0), jsonlite (>= 1.6), magrittr,

 dplyr, vctrs, tibble, lazyeval (>= 0.2.0), rlang (>= 1.0.0),
 crosstalk, purrr, data.table, promises

 rversions, reticulate, rsvg, ggridges
